definition: A term commonly used in the context of live performances, particularly in music concerts, to refer to an additional performance or encore given by the performers in response to an enthusiastic audience. It is typically performed after the main program has concluded, serving as an extra treat or bonus for the audience.

examples.german: Die Zugabe war ein Bonus für die treuen Kunden.
examples.english: The bonus was an extra for the loyal customers.

examples.german: Die Zugabe am Ende des Konzerts war ein weiteres Lied.
examples.english: The encore at the end of the concert was another song.

examples.german: Der Künstler gab eine Zugabe und spielte noch ein Stück.
examples.english: The artist gave an encore and played another piece.

examples.german: Die Zugabe des Schokoladenstücks machte den Kuchen noch leckerer.
examples.english: The addition of the chocolate piece made the cake even more delicious.

examples.german: Die Zugabe von frischen Kräutern verlieh dem Gericht einen besonderen Geschmack.
examples.english: The addition of fresh herbs gave the dish a special flavor.
